page.title: 13SHEBBEAR MEDICAL CENTRE
page.content: The Centre was opened in 1975. There are two doctors, two nurses, one secretary, two receptionists / dispensers, a Health visitor and a district nurse and midwife. The Centre is open from 9 to 12 and 2 to 4 each day except Tuesdays, later when there are surgeries. These are 9-10 or 5-6 on most days. Patients' records are computerised. A second computer prints out prescriptions (which are dispensed at the Centre) and reorders medicines. There are 1800 patients, including 400 boys from Shebbear College. About 30 patients come to surgery daily. Doctors can be contacted anywhere by the centre as they carry a "bleeper" with them. Emergencies average 1 per week, mainly accidents at farms and sawmills.
